meanings.definition: In a manner involving hard work or labor
meanings.sent1: She worked toilfully in the garden, planting seeds and pulling weeds.
meanings.sent2: He toilfully painted the fence under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: The ants toilfully carried food back to their nest, each one doing their part.
meanings.sent4: The old car toilfully climbed up the steep hill, struggling with each turn of the wheel.
meanings.sent5: The determined student toilfully studied for hours to pass the exam.

meanings.sent1: She toilfully lifted the heavy box onto the shelf, grunting with the effort.
meanings.sent2: He toilfully pushed through the dense crowd to reach the front of the line.
meanings.sent3: The cat toilfully tried to catch the elusive laser pointer dot, leaping and pouncing in vain.
meanings.sent4: The athlete toilfully crossed the finish line, gasping for breath after the grueling race.
meanings.sent5: The rescue team toilfully searched through the rubble for survivors, refusing to give up hope.
